data.title: Potatoes for money
data.statement:
You are hired as a trader for world-known "Buy or Sell" finance company. Before you are allowed to trade on European Potatoes Exchange you got a task to analyze data for previous day. 
Exchange rules are:
1. Only potatoes are traded on exchange. Price of potato changes during the day, each new value of a price is called tick.
2. You can buy potatoes for all money that you have on your account and sell all potatoes back later starting from next tick. Only one buy-sell operation is allowed per day. If you buy potatoes you must sell them later. If price is not a divisor of amount of money that you have than you receive fractional number (balance / price) of potatoes.
3. If you don't want to trade today you can skip and amount of money on your account will not change.

You know initial amount of money on your account and have a list of potatoes price ticks during the day. You need to find maximum amount of money that is possible to have your account by the end of the day.

testCases.title: Buy at the morning, sell at the evening
Buy at the morning, sell at the evening

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are hired as a trader for world-known "Buy or Sell" finance company. Before you are allowed to trade on European Potatoes Exchange you got a task to analyze data for previous day.
Exchange rules are:
1. Only potatoes are traded on exchange. Price of potato changes during the day, each new value of a price is called tick.
2. You can buy potatoes for all money that you have on your account and sell all potatoes back later starting from next tick. Only one buy-sell operation is allowed per day. If you buy potatoes you must sell them later. If price is not a divisor of amount of money that you have than you receive fractional number (balance / price) of potatoes.
3. If you don't want to trade today you can skip and amount of money on your account will not change.

You know initial amount of money on your account and have a list of potatoes price ticks during the day. You need to find maximum amount of money that is possible to have your account by the end of the day.
Input
Line 1: Balance Your initial balance
Line 2: N Number of potato price ticks during the day
Next N lines: Price potato price value
Output
Line 1 : Maximum possible amount of money on account by the end of the day, rounded half-up to nearest integer
Constraints
2 ≤ N ≤ 100
0 < Balance
Example
Input
100.0
5
10.0
20.0
30.0
40.0
50.0
Output
500
